user_review: This is an excellent port, I really enjoy having the tiles version of dcss on Android. Some sort of textfile explaining how to use your GUI, as well as the ability to change or resize the keyboard would be nice additions. Edit: The new keyboard with the directions for the yuhjklbn keys is a great addition. I liked your idea for the touch controls but I understand how difficult that must have been to implement given the sheer number of commands in crawl.
pull_request: Menu internals keybinding overhaul I'm opening this as a PR as a preface to merging it before feature freeze. This set of commits changes the internals of the Menu class so that there are abstract CMD_ bindings for most commonly used actions (e.g. pageup, select, etc), rather than hard-coded key bindings. This is mostly an internal overhaul that hopefully makes Menu code easier to deal with overall, though there are a variety of user-facing small changes / bugfixes in the branch. Caveat: rebinding CMD_MENU_... commands is disabled in webtiles, since webtiles has its own client-side menu implementation. This is possible in principle to implement, but non-trivial.
author: rawlins

Keyboard is generally well layed out and has arrows on the directional keys, and inclusion of some useful keys like "5"(rest) without shift or ctrl is nice. No clue why the + is there though, who's entering explore mode so frequently that they need it there rather than a pass turn button?

user_review: Best job at porting Stone Soup I've ever seen! There are a couple keys missing on the keyboard but far and away the best dungeon crawler I've played on Android for free.
pull_request: Fix int params to crawl.sendkeys() Currently crawl.sendkeys(6) sends "6" instead of keycode 6. Due to lua_isstring(int) returning true; ints treated as strings. Moved number check else block ahead of lua_isstring() check. Made number check explicit; lua_isnumber() can return True for strings.

pull_request: Android launcher and improved support for old devices Android launcher A launcher for the Android port supporting new features. Improved support for old devices In theory, DCSS was playable on any device supported by SDL2, that's every version from Android 4.1. However, I tested it using virtual devices and it crashes. This release fixes those crashes and uses the AppCompat library and themes for proper rendering on any supported version. There are other minor changes, please see the commit descriptions for details.

user_review: The game itself is solid. The app does an excellent job bringing the graphical tiles to mobile. I'm not sure of all the UI icons are and can't seem to right click. But if you played the game before it does make some sense from context
pull_request: fix: correct webtiles hidpi implementation This commit reverts 3925e26. (And could use some eyes because of this.) To get hidpi to work in a browser canvas object, the internal dimensions need to be twice that of the external dimensions (essentially). The normal way of implementing this is to multiply the internal dimensions by devicePixelRatio, and scale the canvas accordingly. We used to do this, but 3925e26 changed things so that the external dimensions were halved. This was, according to the commit message, in order to prevent scaling artifacts on firefox. (Where the salient fact is that window.devicePixelRatio on some browsers, these days including chrome/firefox but not safari, also changes with browser zoom.) However, a consequence is that tile rendering is halved on hidpi devices, exactly not what should happen. This change also made for a lot of messy code that had to interact directly with devicePixelRatio. The half-size tile rendering wasn't immediately noticeable because the dungeon is auto-scaled, and the monster list matches its scale to the dungeon. But, icons in menus and popups instantiate the problem, and scaling them to the dungeon size is not ideal. The action panel also had some workarounds for this that I didn't fully understand at the time. (I only noticed this myself after many years of working on this stuff because I switched from a regular-density monitor to a 4k monitor of similar size, even though I've used retina devices for a long time. Hidpi devices have been broken for so long that I won't be surprised if we get requests to readd this behavior as an option or something, menus may look odd now to people who have only ever played on hidpi.) In my testing so far, I can't really detect any rendering differences between the approach after this commit and the approach in 3925e26. However, I'm not exactly sure of what the original issues were, and this commit should be tested on a non-hidpi device before merge.

pull_request: Improved resilience when terminal size changes Changes in the terminal size are very likely to make Crawl crash or misbehave. This small set of patches attempts to improve this situation. Closes #1497 Closes #3045 Closes #2311 issue_#1497: ASSERT(valid_cursor_pos(pos.x, pos.y, region)) in 'libconsole.h' at line 58 [DESCRIPTION:] I start the game, and load the character up. I select "Maximize vertical". This makes the window about 80x90, but the game crashes with the message: ASSERT(valid_cursor_pos(pos.x, pos.y, region)) in 'libconsole.h' at line 58 failed. (invalid cursor position 40,-56 in region 1) If I start the game with an 80x90 window, it opens correctly, but making the window smaller, and then larger again, also makes it crash. If I make the window narrower or wider, even if I make it higher at the same time, it doesn't crash. issue_#3045: Crash: Octopode Chaos Knight, "invalid cursor position" [DESCRIPTION:] I had just equipped a second short blade weapon, at least that's the last thing I remember doing. user_review: The best roguelike on the market. The amount of depth and the sense of exploration is unparalleled.
pull_request: Allow adjusting of explore_greedy non autopickup item visit method explore_greedy_visit is added as an rc file option to adjust explore_greedy behavior. By default greedy explore travels to piles of items on each square in addition to items that are eligible for autopickup. This setting allows to also/only go to enchanted items instead. By choosing "enchanted" greedy exploration will ignore piles of mundane items and only visit the squares which contain enchanted items. Choosing "both" will visit piles and singular enchanted items.

pull_request: Make greedy explore less greedy Autoexplore does a lot of unnecessary item piles revisits now. For example, if you kill a monster that has a dagger of freezing, a plain +0 hat, and an artefact, autoexplore could visit the resulting pile of items up to four times. These (re)visits happen after This PR fixes unnecessary revisits 2), 3), and 4). Also, it reduces the number of unnecessary autotravel interruptions by ignoring piles of useless items during greedy explore.

pull_request: Fix estimation of the minimum usable window size We were using the m_fonts array to get the font sizes. This is wrong because caching leads to unpredictable array contents. Now we are using proper char width and height. It also has the benefit of improved precision. The bug was reported in reddit: https://www.reddit.com/r/dcss/comments/107d1tj/what_has_changed_with_the_ui_trunk_compiled/
author: robertxgray

user_review: Nice game but the menu ui is absolutely atrocious
pull_request: Fix the way the scroller works when a menu grows. Previously, if a player had a spell library containing every spell, searching it for "hat" led to Shatter being selected. Searching for "a" after this led to Shatter still being selected, but only the top of the spell list being displayed. This happened because UIMenu::update_items() resized item_info but didn't set the x, y, row or column fields, and UIMenu::get_item_region() relied on those being up to date. Call UIMenu::do_layout() to fix it.

pull_request: fix: click + key modifier detection in tiles Fixes #898 The issue was caused because SDL_GetModState returns an OR'd combination of the modifier keys, but SDLWrapper::get_mod_state was comparing against the exact values of the flags. issue_#898: Shift+Left Click sometimes equips weapon instead of dropping it When reporting a bug, please include the following: [DESCRIPTION:] When you have a weapon in the inventory that you want to drop, Shift+Left Clicking it sometimes equips it instead of dropping it. I can't find any specific way to reproduce this behavior, except that when the issue starts to occur, it continues to occur until you save the game and load it again. If I do find a specific way to reproduce it, I'll comment to let you know.

user_review: Steep learning curve for newcomers (tutorials are certainly important), but deep and varied gameplay makes it well worth learning to play. Multiple play styles offer tons of replayability. Consistent content updates are both a blessing and a curse but definitely keep it fresh. All in all this is a solid dungeon crawling rougelike with NO adverts or in app purchases disturbing you at every turn, unlike most of the other games available on these mobile operating systems.

pull_request: Android: Add a full screen option to the launcher I got this message from an Android user: can't enable full screen mode by setting "tile_full_screen = true", still shows a black bar on top with device status. I agree a full screen option for Android can improve the user experience. Mostly when playing on landscape mode with modern devices. You can read this in the docs: Where you set the UI flags makes a difference. If you hide the system bars in your activity's onCreate() method and the user presses Home, the system bars will reappear. When the user reopens the activity, onCreate() won't get called, so the system bars will remain visible. If you want system UI changes to persist as the user navigates in and out of your activity, set UI flags in onResume() or onWindowFocusChanged(). Tried both options and the behaviour when using onWindowsFocusChanged is more consistent. When using onResume, full screen is lost whenever you open the top menu.
